title: Unknown bug involving unused variables and packages.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Summary: Running into a bug when including (but not using the Gfx2d object) the [gfx_graphics](https://github.com/PistonDevelopers/gfx_graphics) library.

I tried to build the code found in one of my repos: [fluid-rs](https://github.com/elrnv/fluid-rs), with `cargo build`

I expected to it to compile and run a simple glfw window displaying a wireframe cube, which is what happens if I remove the line including the `gfx_graphics` library and creating the Gfx2d object (the lines shown in the warnings in the backtrace)

Instead, compilation failed with the following backtrace.
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

rustc 1.0.0-nightly (ea8b82e90 2015-03-17) (built 2015-03-18)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: ea8b82e90c450febb1f26a07862a1ec89c22addd
commit-date: 2015-03-17
build-date: 2015-03-18
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.0.0-nightly

Backtrace:

main.rs:39:28: 39:35 warning: unused import, #[warn(unused_imports)] on by default
main.rs:39 use gfx_graphics::{ Gfx2d, Texture };
                                      ^~~~~~~
main.rs:251:9: 251:16 warning: unused variable: `g2d`, #[warn(unused_variables)] on by default
main.rs:251     let mut g2d = Gfx2d::new(&mut context.device);
                    ^~~~~~~
main.rs:251:9: 251:16 warning: variable does not need to be mutable, #[warn(unused_mut)] on by default
main.rs:251     let mut g2d = Gfx2d::new(&mut context.device);
                    ^~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'arithmetic operation overflowed', /Users/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-mac/build/src/libsyntax/codemap.rs:73
